intro: Syrenia quadrangula, commonly known as the four-angled sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is characterized by its quadrangular, woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white, often with a yellow or orange center. Syrenia quadrangula thrives in coastal environments, often found in mangrove swamps or sandy shores. Its botanical features make it an important species in marine and coastal ecosystems.
